commented_code:
# Build website assets (CSS/JS).
           npm ci && npm run prod
           # Build the static website.
-          hugo -v --minify
+          hugo --minify --logLevel info

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -67,7 +65,7 @@ jobs:
           # Build website assets (CSS/JS).
           npm ci && npm run prod
           # Build the static website.
-          hugo -v --minify
+          hugo --minify --logLevel info
discussion_comments.comment_body:
might be easier to just use the npm-managed binary? I think the `peaceiris/actions-hugo` action predated our use of https://www.npmjs.com/package/hugo-bin:
```suggestion
          npx hugo --minify --logLevel info
```

+          hugo --minify --logLevel info
discussion_comments.comment_body: Good catch. Tested it in python-poetry/website#162 and adopted it.

commented_code:
strategy:
       matrix:
         os: [Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows]
-        python-version: [3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9]
+        python-version: ["3.6", "3.7", "3.8", "3.9", "pypy-3.7"]

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ jobs:
     strategy:
       matrix:
         os: [Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows]
-        python-version: [3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9]
+        python-version: ["3.6", "3.7", "3.8", "3.9", "pypy-3.7"]
discussion_comments.comment_body:
Please pin to the latest version, otherwise the setup-python action gets an older version which is cached in the virtual image rather than downloading the latest one which fixes a number of bugs. The new versions should hit the [virtual images in a few days](https://github.com/actions/virtual-environments/issues/4347#issuecomment-951952950), so if you wait the version update will fix itself.
```suggestion
        python-version: ["3.6", "3.7", "3.8", "3.9", "pypy-3.7-v7.3.7"]
```

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -23,7 +23,7 @@ jobs:
     strategy:
       matrix:
         os: [Ubuntu, MacOS, Windows]
-        python-version: [3.6, 3.7, 3.8, 3.9]
+        python-version: ["3.6", "3.7", "3.8", "3.9", "pypy-3.7"]
